2025 taught me one big lesson: my most valuable trade wasn't a win; it was a spectacular, expensive mistake.  It was a classic $XRP  pump. FOMO was intense, chat was going wild, and I YOLO'd into a massive green candle. I went all-in, convinced I'd just secured my year. You can guess what happened next.  The reversal was just as fast. I watched my portfolio bleed, paralyzed by that "it'll come back" feeling. It didn't. I closed at a brutal loss, feeling stupid and frustrated.  For weeks, I just stared at that chart, replaying my bad decision in my head. Then I threw the entire setup into GetAgent. I asked it to analyze the market conditions on that day, the social sentiment, and the risk of my entry size.  The AI didn't just give me data; it gave me a post-mortem. It showed me exactly how my emotional decision ignored clear risk signals. It became my unbiased, brutally honest trading journal.  The wild part? The "tuition" for that lesson was paid for by BGB. Trading US tokenized stocks on @BitgetGlobal  this year helped me stay focused, track my performance, and learn from every move, not just crypto. Not every trade was perfect, but every trade was a lesson. Those rewards gave me the runway to make mistakes, learn from them, and still have capital left to trade with.  My biggest takeaway this year? Discipline isn't something you're born with; it's something you build, sometimes with the help of an AI co-pilot and a platform that rewards your participation.  What was your most expensive trading lesson this year?
